title: A Great Summer of Great Tables
text:
What I Learned

Package Development


Development Organization
With a little shame, I must admit I never knew how to use a branch. Thatâ€™s an exaggeration. I knew what a branch was, and I knew to make one so I didnâ€™t have to commit to the main branch. The shameful part is once I had a branch, all the new code went into that. (ðŸ™ˆ Donâ€™t look at the repository for this website). And then one day, when I felt like there was probably too much code I hadnâ€™t commited to the main branch, Iâ€™d merge it and ta-da, surely that was good enoughâ€¦ right?
With even more shame, I have to admit I didnâ€™t know how to write a suite of tests.
When I say Iâ€™ve learned to do these things, I donâ€™t mean Iâ€™m a pro. I mean with the mentoring of Rich and Michael, I am now much better at adhering these practices than I used to be.


Writing things like this!
Whether itâ€™s a blog post for me (this one!), a blog post for Great Tables or a blog post for the entirety of Posit, I have had no shortage of oppotunites to talk about myself. As you might guess, this doesnâ€™t come naturally to me, but itâ€™s yet another skill Iâ€™ve gotten to practice and hone in my summer at Posit.
In every instance (yes, even the slides), my musings are presented with the help of Quarto markdown. I promise this isnâ€™t an ad, but having never used Quarto before this summer, I can confidently say I canâ€™t imagine a life without it.

title: About
text:
I graduated from Williams College in 2023 with a double major in computer science and math. After my undergraduate education, I spent a year in Spain teaching computer science, among other topics, at a vocational school. Iâ€™ve also had the good fortune to join batches at the Recurse Center in summer of 2022 and fall of 2024 in which I spent time building out a number of projects, like this or this!
Last year, I helped out in the Michigan Dems 2024 campaign, writing some texting scripts and mostly organzing volunteer door-knockers and phone bankers. More recently I worked as a maintainer for an in-house Student Information Service for a local high school, which entailed a full-stack React/NextJS project deployed on Vercel.
Currently Iâ€™m working as a Great Tables intern for Posit!

ðŸ”­ My role now involves the development of a supplemental great-tables package called gt-extras!
ðŸ”­ Itâ€™s written in Python, and built for the same functionality offered by a sister R package, found here.
ðŸŒ± Iâ€™m also currently learning how to toy around with R Shiny apps, one of which can be found here.
ðŸ’¬ Iâ€™m looking to collaborate on gt-extras, please submit issues and PRâ€™s if youâ€™re interested!
ðŸ‘¯ I spend my free time rock climbing, playing soccer and table tennis, and volunteering at a weekly legal clinic.
